metadata.synopsis: If Balthazar is alive when the player reaches Nightsong, they will encounter a dialogue where Balthazar and Nightsong square off. The player has one last chance to betray Balthazar and prevent him from taking Nightsong to Moonrise.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Approach Nightsong at -712; -142; -1427 with Balthazar still alive

65.speaker: Nightsong
65.text: Balthazar. Come to add more bars to my cage.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

38.speaker: Nightsong
38.text: Or perhaps to lead this would-be Justiciar's blade directly to my heart?
38.context: CinematicNodeContext:  On "this Justiciar"," abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves forward out of position, magical hands grab around her wrists arms and shoulers, holding her back. She looks down at them and grimaces in rage, then steps back into place. This is how she's bound: If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by the magi-hands.

32.speaker: Nightsong
32.text: I invite you: heap more sins upon your head. My retribution will be all the sweeter for them.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring Balthazar dead in the eyes.NodeContext: With a deep, seething foreboding

51.speaker: Balthazar
51.text: All this time, and you still fail to appreciate the gifts I bestowed on you, Aylin. Sad, to see a thing of beauty not recognise its own worth.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Displeased poutNodeContext: A little displeased and admonishing

56.speaker: Balthazar
56.text: But General Thorm - he appreciates you. And he wants you close at hand, so I am here to whisk you back to him.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brightening upNodeContext: Tone brightening up a little

48.speaker: Nightsong
48.text: Ketheric. I welcome the sight of him, after these hundred years. He whose immortality I supply with my very soul.
48.context: NodeContext: She spits on the floor of her cage after 'Ketheric'

27.speaker: Balthazar
27.text: General. Thorm. You will show respect, Aylin. Watch, and see what happens if you do not. See what I do to our acquaintance here.
27.context: NodeContext: Chastising Nightsong. Grows menacing towards the end as it becomes clear he's referring to us while addressing Nightsong.

30.speaker: Balthazar
30.text: You. Your usefulness does not forgive your treachery. I felt it the very first moment I entered your mind. You are an enemy of the Absolute, banished from Moonrise.

52.speaker: Balthazar
52.text: Perhaps there will be something I can salvage from your carcass once I'm finished; I hate to see flesh squandered - even a traitor's flesh.

61.speaker: Balthazar
61.text: General. Thorm. I'm sure you'll be on your best behaviour for him. But just in case, I've taken some precautions.

50.speaker: Balthazar
50.text: Keep back. It will take quite some concentration to secure Aylin for her little journey.

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: The Nightsong is Shar's sacrifice - she's my destiny. He cannot have her!
62.context: NodeContext: Urgent. Her sacred mission is in jeopardy

11.speaker: Shar
11.text: Stop him. Nightsong must not leave. She must die by my spear, or you will have failed me.
11.context: InternalNodeContext: This line from Shar only plays if Shadowheart is the avatarNodeContext: Urgent

29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
29.text: I stand with you, Shadowheart. Slay the Nightsong, and take your place as a Dark Justiciar.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Do as Shar wishes, and you will become Her chosen, but the Absolute cult will know you are its enemy.*

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Wait - the Nightsong is a person?

21.speaker: Balthazar
21.text: Person? Please, you insult her - you insult me.

12.speaker: Balthazar
12.text: Aylin is so much more than that. She is an aasimar, bound to a soulcage of my creation, and lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.

40.speaker: Balthazar
40.text: Her power, his will, and my genius. An unsurpassable feat.

66.speaker: Nightsong
66.text: Ramblings most unsane. Poor Balthazar, for maggots ate his brain long ago.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: A mirthless humor in her voice

43.speaker: Balthazar
43.text: Hold your tongue, Aylin. Or I'll take it away from you again. And you - no more questions. No more interference.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: First sentence addressed to Nightsong. Glances at player for second sentence.NodeContext: First line to Nightsong, second to player.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: If she's the reason Ketheric Thorm is invulnerable, you're not taking her. Leave, or you're a dead man.

4.speaker: Balthazar
4.text: Dead man? You haven't been paying attention, have you? Perhaps I'll revive your carcass, and add you to my retinue. Then you'll have all the time in the world to think on your mistakes.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Go on, then. Take the Nightsong to Ketheric. Get it over with.

58.speaker: Balthazar
58.text: Get it over with? No, this is to be savoured. Return to Moonrise Towers - I'm sure we'll find further use for you there.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the playerNodeContext: Addressed to the player

17.speaker: Balthazar
17.text: Now don't struggle, Aylin. Well... maybe struggle a little.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: To nightsong.NodeContext: Spoken with some relish

64.speaker: Nightsong
64.text: A pleasure to have made your acquaintance, little warrior. We will meet again. I am eternal; I will be free, one day; and I never forget a face.

57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar performs the ritual that transports him and Nightsong to Moonrise

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Your blood chills as you await Lady Shar's wrath for your failure... but there is nothing. The silence is terrifying.*
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Shadowheart glances upwards, looking fearful.

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: What have you done?! Her fate was mine to decide!
54.context: NodeContext: Shock and outrage. Her moment of religious fulfilment has been denied.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Finding a cure is what matters - now we have Ketheric Thorm's trust.

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: You may have his trust, but you've lost mine. Farewell.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I make the decisions - not you.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Then this is where we part ways. Shar forgive me, I was so close... Farewell.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I'm sorry. But I have my reasons. I did what I thought was best.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: What you thought was best...? This was important to me - this was everything to me.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: There's nothing more to be said. Farewell.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I couldn't let you kill her.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: Perhaps it wouldn't have come to that. But we'll never know now - you took the decision away from me.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I agree - no more questions. More blood. YOURS.

6.speaker: Balthazar
6.text: So eager to die. Very well, brute - you will make a welcome addition to my undying retinue.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I care not for the holy creature - but you tricked me, necromancer. For that: you die.

13.speaker: Balthazar
13.text: Death only frightens those of limited vision. You should be terrified, godling.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: The Nightsong is angel-born. It deserves freedom.

9.speaker: Balthazar
9.text: What would a godling know of freedom? Come - I will show you freedom. From want. From need. From everything.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You will torture this angel-born no longer, necromancer.

7.speaker: Balthazar
7.text: The arrogance of divinity. Your patron will not hear your prayers when I add you to my undying retinue, godling.

46.speaker: Balthazar
46.text: Fly at me, you fool. You cannot stop what is to come.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: What are you going to do to her?

44.speaker: Balthazar
44.text: Bring her home - what else? Aylin is so much more than you comprehend. She is an aasimar, bound to a soulcage of my creation, and lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I can't let you take her, Balthazar.

55.speaker: Balthazar
55.text: I can do whatever I want! She is mine. An aasimar bound to a soulcage of my creation. Lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: My companion has her own plans for this one. Stand down.

37.speaker: Balthazar
37.text: Plans. The drone plans to court the queen bee - yet it dies all the same. Aylin is mine - an aasimar bound to a soulcage of my creation. Lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.
37.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. Mocking drawl on the first 'plans' Ah-see-mar

41.speaker: Player
41.text: She is a person - not a thing to be used. On my oath, she will be freed.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Impressive work, Balthazar, but you are not needed anymore. The Nightsong is our sacrifice.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: The Nightsong's a person? Balthazar, this is an affront to the Weave itself.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: If I'd known you were hunting a person, I'd have charged for my services.

67.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
67.text: If this Nightsong is the source of Ketheric's power, we cannot let Balthazar take her. We should unleash her wrath.
